intro: Cassebeeria pilosula, commonly known as the hairy cassebeeria, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, giving it its common name. It produces yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Cassebeeria pilosula is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas.
